channel.title: Space Station News
channel.description: A RSS news feed containing the latest NASA press releases on the International Space Station.

item.title: Media Invited to News Conference with NASA Astronaut Anne McClain and Space Station Crewmates
item.description: NASA astronaut Anne McClain, along with her crewmates, David Saint-Jacques of the Canadian Space Agency and Oleg Kononenko of the Russian space agency Roscosmos, will discuss their upcoming mission to the International Space Station in a news conference at 2 p.m. EDT Thursday, Sept. 6, at NASA’s Johnson Space Center in Houston.

item.title: NASA Astronaut to Speak with Students, Parents, Teachers at YouthSpark
item.description: Students attending Microsoft’s YouthSpark event will have the opportunity to speak with NASA astronauts aboard the International Space Station next week as part of NASA’s Year of Education on Station.

item.title: NASA Television to Air Russian Spacewalk at International Space Station
item.description: Russian cosmonauts living and working on the International Space Station will venture outside Wednesday, Aug. 15, for a spacewalk expected to last about six hours. Live coverage of the excursion will air on NASA Television and the agency’s website.

item.title: NASA Invests in Concepts for a Vibrant Future Commercial Space Economy
item.description: In an ongoing effort to foster commercial activity in space, NASA has selected 13 companies to study the future of commercial human spaceflight in low-Earth orbit, including long-range opportunities for the International Space Station.

item.title: NASA Television, Website to Air Critical Conversations on Science in Space
item.description: NASA will join counterparts from across government, industry, academia and international organizations for an indepth conversation about science on the International Space Station Monday, July 23, through Thursday, July 26, in San Francisco.

item.title: Students from Missouri, Mississippi to Call Space Station
item.description: Students in St. Louis and southern Mississippi will get to ask questions of NASA astronauts on the International Space Station during two events next week as part of NASA’s Year of Education on Station.

item.title: Coverage Set for Departure of US Cargo Ship from International Space Station
item.description: Nearly two months after Orbital ATK, now part of Northrop Grumman, delivered several tons of supplies and scientific experiments to the International Space Station aboard its Cygnus cargo spacecraft, the spacecraft is set to depart the orbiting laboratory Sunday, July 15.

item.title: NASA Names Six New Flight Directors to Lead Mission Control
item.description: NASA has selected six women and men to join the elite corps of flight directors who will lead mission control for a variety of new operations at the agency’s Johnson Space Center in Houston.

item.title: Students from Ohio, Virginia, Maryland, Massachusetts to Call Space Station
item.description: Next week astronauts aboard the International Space Station will host several downlinks as part of NASA’s Year of Education on Station.

item.title: NASA TV to Air Launch, Docking of Russian Cargo Delivery to Space Station
item.description: A Russian cargo ship loaded with almost three tons of food, fuel and supplies is set to launch to the International Space Station Monday, July 9. Live coverage of the spacecraft’s launch and docking will air on NASA Television and the agency’s website.
